is a small community in the
on five miles of Lake Michigan Shoreline.  Approximately 10 minutes from Petoskey and 15 minutes from Charlevoix.

There are private neighborhoods within the community that are gated, but other areas that are open to the public. Ride your bike here on the Little Traverse Wheelway which is a 23 mile non-motorized path from Charlevoix to Harbor Springs. Make Bay  Harbor a stopping point. You can also drive here and park and walk to several of the amenities. Bay Harbor is also the largest per capita user of GEM (Global Electric Motor) vehicles in the world.  The 300 GEM cars at Bay Harbor save our atmosphere from an estimated 450 tons of carbon emissions annually.

value: : Escape for a few hours to a contemporary place with an eclectic blend of shops and eateries. A four seasons village with premier annual events throughout the year including Ice & Spice Festival, Vintage Car & Boat Festival and Bay Harbor Art Fair.

Named as one of the “Top 10 Ports” in North America by Motorboating Magazine.  Floating docks are designed to accommodate boats ranging in size from 20 to 200 feet in length. Premier events include In Water Boat Show in June and Bay Harbor Fishing Tournament in September.

Everything that a horseman could want: lessons for all ages, exciting shows and clinics with world-renown trainers, a 42,000 square foot stable and indoor arena, an outdoor track and training area and the personal attention that you and your horse deserve all in a breathtaking setting.
Shop, Eat, Enjoy...Like Nowhere Else in the Village at Bay Harbor. Open 7 days a week.

"Go To an Event": Bay Harbor has many premier events that are held throughout the year.  Contact Marketing Coordinator, Michelle Culver at 231-439-2000 to hear what is going on in Bay Harbor for 2009!
"Rent a Boat" from the Lake Marina from Lake Michigan Yacht Sales. Contact 231-439-2675 for information
Go Charter Fishing" - Two fishing charters docked at Bay Harbor Lake Marina, two fishing trips daily during the season.  Enjoy trips with "Plumbers Helper" or "Gail Force Charters"
"Get Married" in several unique and beautiful venues in Bay Harbor. Contact Group Sales Coordinator, Megan Nickerson at 231-439-2000.
Enroll in a clinic, or take horse lessons at the Bay Harbor Equestrian Club.  Contact Jakki Baltzer at 231-439-7100 for information.
Get Stylish" at ilaria Hair Studio, providing clients with sophisticated styling and unparalleled customer service.
